data.chText: 发起抗议 / 运动；举办展览
迫使政府修改法律的压力不断增加。
data.enText: Pressure is mounting on the government to change the law.
The death toll continues to mount.
to go up sth, or up on to sth that is raised

data.chText: 他登上讲台对人群发表演说。
data.enText: He mounted the platform and addressed the crowd.
to get on a bicycle, horse, etc. in order to ride it
He mounted his horse and rode away.
to fix sth into position on sth, so that you can use it, look at it or study it
The specimens were mounted on slides.

data.chText: 这颗钻石镶在金饰物上。
data.enText: The diamond is mounted in gold.

data.chText: 爬上（雌性动物的背）进行交配
data.enText: to get onto the back of a female animal in order to have sex
to increase gradually in size and quantity

data.chText: 同时，我的债务在不断增加。
data.enText: Meanwhile, my debts were mounting up.

before.chText: 在现代英语里仅用于地名
before.enText: used in modern English only in place names

data.enText: a horse that you ride on

data.chText: 用以展示 / 支持某物

data.enText: something such as a piece of card or glass that you put sth on or attach sth to, to display it
something that an object stands on or is attached to for support

means: 爬上（雌性动物的背）进行交配

ex.enText: The old man slowly ascended the stairs.

synonyms.bx: 指位置升高，也指人攀登到较高的地方。

ex.chText: 上个月通货膨胀率上涨了2.5％。

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，尤指手脚并用地费力攀登，也可指数字、数量、水平等攀升。

ex.enText: He mounted the stairs and looked around.
It is hard to climb up a mountain.

ex.chText: 那个国家最高的山是哪座？
ex.enText: Which is the highest mountain in that country?

synonyms.bx: 通常指大山，比 hill 高。

ex.chText: 在那座陡峭的小山上有一栋房子。
ex.enText: There is a house on that steep hill.

ex.chText: 这些孩子喜欢在那个长满树木的山丘上玩耍。
ex.enText: These children like to play games on that wooded hill.

synonyms.bx: 通常指不如 mountain 那样高大的小山、小丘、丘陵。

ex.chText: 一组专家来到了珠穆朗玛峰的山脚下。
ex.enText: A group of experts arrived at the foot of Mount Qomolangma.

ex.chText: 他决定与其他人一起爬山。
ex.enText: He decided to climb the mount with others.

synonyms.bx: 用作山名的一部分，通常首字母大写，或略作 Mt；在文学作品中与 mountain 同义。

data.enText: to increase gradually in size and quantity

data.chText: 同时，我的债务在不断增加。
data.enText: Meanwhile, my debts were mounting up.

example: it was a difficult climb to the top

tr: a lightweight horse kept for riding only
something forming a back that is added for strengthening
a mounting consisting of a piece of metal (as in a ring or other jewelry) that holds a gem in place
example: the diamond was in a plain gold mount

tr: a land mass that projects well above its surroundings
fix onto a backing, setting, or support

example: Sales were climbing after prices were lowered
They mounted the aerator on a floating
The bull was riding the cow

tr: prepare and supply with the necessary equipment for execution or performance
go upward with gradual or continuous progress
example: Did you ever climb up the hill behind your house?

tr: get up on the back of

value.def: If you mount a campaign or event, you organize it and make it take place.

example.ex: The ANC announced it was mounting a major campaign of mass political protests.
example.tran: 非洲人国民大会宣布他们正在开展一次大规模政治抗议活动。

example.ex: ...a security operation mounted by the army.
example.tran: 军队开展的维护安全军事行动

value.def: If something mounts, it increases in intensity.

example.ex: For several hours, tension mounted...
example.tran: 有几个小时，紧张局势有所加剧。

example.ex: The decibel level was mounting...
example.tran: 噪音在增强。

example.ex: There was mounting concern in her voice.
example.tran: 她的声音里流露出越来越多的担心。

example.ex: ...the mounting heat of the stadium.
example.tran: 体育场不断上升的热度

value.def: If something mounts, it increases in quantity.

example.ex: The uncollected garbage mounts in city streets...
example.tran: 未收的垃圾在市区街道上越积越多。

example.ex: He ignored his mounting debts.
example.tran: 他对日益增加的债务置之不理。

posc.def: To mount up means the same as to mount .

example.ex: If you hide away your problems and pretend that they don't exist they will just continue to mount up...
example.tran: 如果你把问题藏起来，假装它们不存在，问题只会越积越多。

example.ex: Her medical bills mounted up.
example.tran: 她的医疗费不断增加。

value.def: If you mount the stairs or a platform, you go up the stairs or go up onto the platform.

example.ex: Llewelyn was mounting the stairs up into the keep...
example.tran: 卢埃林登上台阶，走进城堡主楼。

example.ex: The vehicle mounted the pavement.
example.tran: 机动车开上了人行道。

value.def: If you mount a horse or cycle, you climb on to it so that you can ride it.

example.ex: He mounted his horse and rode away...
example.tran: 他骑上马走了。

example.ex: A man in a crash helmet was mounting a motorbike...
example.tran: 一位戴头盔的男子正跨上摩托车。

example.ex: He went to the small stable where his horse was, harnessed it, mounted, and rode out to the beach.
example.tran: 他走进拴马的小马厩，套上马具，骑上马奔向海滩。

example.ex: ...the number of owners who care for older mounts.
example.tran: 愿意照料老马的马主的数量

value.def: If you mount an object on something, you fix it there firmly.

example.ex: Her husband mounts the work on velour paper and makes the frame...
example.tran: 她丈夫把作品装裱在绒纸上，并制作了画框。

example.ex: The support for the fence is mounted on an extension to the table.
example.tran: 篱笆的支撑部分安装在桌子延长出的地方。

example.ex: ...a specially mounted horse shoe.
example.tran: 特别安装的马蹄铁

example.ex: ...a wall-mounted electric fan.
example.tran: 安装在墙上的电扇

example.ex: ...pickup trucks with side-mounted fuel tanks.
example.tran: 油箱置于侧面的轻型货车

value.def: If you mount an exhibition or display, you organize and present it.

example.ex: The gallery has mounted an exhibition of art by Irish women painters.
example.tran: 画廊已举办了一场爱尔兰女画家的作品展。

value.def: Mount is used as part of the name of a mountain.

example.ex: ...Mount Kilimanjaro.
example.tran: 乞力马扎罗山

trans: 表贴；表面安装；表面贴装式；表面贴装；表面黏着
富士山；皮特叔叔；富士山下；日本的富士山；日本富士山
发动机架；发动机安装节
奥林匹亚山；奥林匹斯山
镜头架；镜头卡口；镜头卡座；镜头接口；卡口

partsOfSpeech.dec: dis 分离 + mount 登上；升 → 从…上下来 → 下车；下马
in 不 + sur 超 + mount 登上；升 + able 能…的 → 不能超过的 → 难以克服的

partsOfSpeech.d: 山丘（登上〔山丘〕→ 登上；山丘）

partsOfSpeech.dec: mount 登上；升 + ain 表物 → 山
mountain 登上；升 + ous …的 → 如山一样大的 → 巨大的
mounte 登上；升 → 登上长椅〔卖假药〕→ 江湖骗子
re 重新 + mount 登上；升 → 重新登上
sur 超 + mount 登上；升 → 越过山 → 登上
